meanings.sent1: The cows graze peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The deer graze on the lush green grass in the forest.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could graze like a cow all day and not worry about anything else.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes graze over the menu, trying to decide what to order.
meanings.sent5: The sheep graze lazily under the warm sun, enjoying their meal.

meanings.sent1: The butterfly will graze your hand as it flies by.
meanings.sent2: His fingertips graze the surface of the water as he reaches out.
meanings.sent3: The feather will graze your cheek softly, tickling you.
meanings.sent4: Her words graze his heart, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The wind will graze your skin gently, cooling you down.

meanings.definition: A minor injury to the skin caused by rubbing against a rough surface
meanings.sent1: She got a graze on her knee from falling on the pavement.
meanings.sent2: The child showed his friends the graze on his elbow from playing outside.
meanings.sent3: He proudly displayed his graze, claiming it was a battle scar.
meanings.sent4: The graze on her palm stung a little when she touched it.
meanings.sent5: The graze on his forehead was a reminder of the bike accident.
